text:
Generous police officer gives homeless man his own jacket to protect him from the cold By Belinda Grant-Geary 
A police officer in the US has made good on a promise to a homeless man he spotted wearing little to protect him from the blistering cold. 
Snow was falling when Chicago police officer Peter White noticed a homeless man panhandling in the middle of the road and became concerned he may cause an accident. 
As he wrote the man a ticket for blocking traffic, Mr White noticed the man was wearing a thin jacket that offered little warmth. 
"Knowing that it was still cold I said 'the next time I see you I'll bring a jacket',' Mr White said. A police officer in the US has made good on a promise to a homeless man he spotted wearing little to protect him from the blistering cold. (Source: Facebook) 
The generous police officer went home and was sure to pack a thick coat in his squad car for the homeless man. 
But when he went to make his deliver, the man was nowhere to be seen. 
Weeks passed before Mr White noticed the man again, standing out in the cold. 
He promptly jumped out of his squad car and assured the man he was not at risk of another fine. 
"There will be no ticket today, just the jacket," he can be heard saying as he slips the coat over the man's shoulders. 
Mr White's partner Bob Osborne filmed the exchange and uploaded the video to Facebook where the act of kindness did not go unnoticed. 
"My partner Pete doing a good deed. We wrote this guy a ticket 3 weeks ago and he had a thin little jacket so Pete promised him that he would bring him his old coat. When we finally saw him again Pete gave him his coat. See Pete White you are not such a bad guy. CPD is the best!" 
Hundreds of people commended the officer for his generosity and the video was viewed by thousands. Â© Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
